acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The charter and account book were transferred to Special Collections on September 22, 2004 by Dr. Ian MacGillivray of the Department of Education. Remaining items were in the cage in 1982, at the time of founding.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The records are a merger of the documents from the collection KDP 2004-0922, Kappa Delta Pi, and select papers located in SU 93-0031, Students: Memorabilia and General.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Kappa Delta Pi, the International Honor Society in education, was founded in 1911 at the University of Illinois, and was one of the first discipline-specific honor societies. On January 30, 1928 members of the Pi Kappa Omega Society at the State Teachers College, also an honors society, dissolved their chapter and reformed as the Alpha Chi Chapter of the Kappa Delta Pi. According to the Katherine Pace, the first Alpha Chi chapter historian, the decision to join Kappa Delta Pi was an effort to grow the society's membership in order to "enlarge its service and become a more active and progressive organization."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Alpha Chi Chapter of the Kappa Delta Pi Records are comprised of a record book, an account book, original charter, and collected papers that document the history of the Alpha Chi Chapter of the Kappa Delta Pi, at the State Teachers College at Harrisonburg. Kappa Delta Pi is the International Honor Society in the field of education. The records are largely comprised of essays, written each year by the organization's historian, that summarize the activities and accomplishments of the organization. An account book contains a record of expenses and membership dues.
